title: Star Wars Video Highlights Facebook 360 Footage
text:
Star Wars is among the films and publishers using the ability to post new 360-degree videos on Facebook. The videos, which are being rolled out on news feeds from today, are made by a special set of cameras used to record all angles of a scene simultaneously.
When the video is played on Facebook, the viewer can choose which angle they want to view it from by dragging the video with a computer cursor or by dragging it with your finger on phones or tablets.
YouTube launched 360-degree videos in March
Pointing a mobile phone or a tablet in different directions will also change the angle of the video, making it feel more immersive.
Also among those using the new video type are Discovery, GoPro, VICE, Disney and NBC's Saturday Night Live. The 360-degree version of Star Wars: The Force Awakens will allow viewers to feel like they are in the Star Wars universe, Facebook says.
Facebook bought Oculus VR last year
The videos are to be rolled out on the web and Android "soon" and for iOS "in the coming months", Facebook added.
Facebook bought Oculus VR for $2bn (Â£1.3bn) in 2014 and has long-term ambitions to host and create virtual reality content.
It's going head-to-head with Facebook which rolled out its own 360-degree videos in March.
Meanwhile Kolor, which makes 360-degree video software owned by GoPro, makes its own player for mobiles and desktops.
